passages.text: China (PRC) | Electronic Components
2Q25 Beat; Well Positioned for High-end Optics Upgrade Cycle

2Q25 rev slight beat driven by growth in micro prism shipment and strong auto rev. GM/EBIT/NP also beat suggesting continued economy of scale.Clear roadmap of US customer's upgrade on smartphone optics implies multiple new growth curves going forward for Crystal as involved in most projects. Both HUD and LiDAR optical window saw robust shipment growth,and AR's commercialization may also be accelerated, positive for key supply chain players. Reiterate BUY.

**2Q25 beat.** Crystal's 2Q25 rev grew 17% YoY, slightly beating cons by 4% mainly driven by 1)solid shipment growth of micro prism thanks to wider adoption on more models; and 2) strong shipment growth in auto-related products. GM slightly dropped 0.4ppt YoY but rose 3.0ppt QoQ, beating cons by 0.8ppt as auto & AR GM spiked 16.8ppt YoY in 1H25. EBIT/NP increased 17%/13% YoY, largely beating cons by 14%/22% with further control on opex and economy of scale. For 2025, mgt kept original guidance unchanged at 0-30% rev growth, stable opex ratio and 10-15% capex ratio as of rev.

**Future upside on smartphone optics could be underestimated.** Crystal's new NPI projects on US customer's main camera is progressing smoothly, which could be a major driver in 2026. Mgt suggested the customer will have more innovations in coming years such as further upgrade on main camera (likely in 2028), front side, glass cover etc. and Crystal is involved in most projects, implying multiple potential new growth curves going forward.

**Brighter outlook for auto & AR.** Mgt pointed out auto HUD shipment was almost double in 1H25 with major customers including Changan, Dongfeng Voyah, Mazda and more going forward. The launch of LCoS AR HUD in 2026 should achieve better ASP/GM to further drive up rev. In addition, LiDAR optical window also saw robust shipment growth with market share at ~50% in the industry. Glass-base window has already passed qualification, poised for mass production in Q4 for robot customers. On AR side, we also think the recent cooperation between Goertek and Sunny_on optical waveguide is not a threat, but instead a positive sign for the whole industryTo accelerate AR commercialization. Due to differences in usage performance/scenario,we think two technologies (geometric/diffractive) are more likely to be developed in parallel rather than replace each other in future. Therefore, the accelerated development of AR could be good news for most key supply chain players.

**Reiterate BUYoWe slightly raise our 2025E-27E rev/NP forecast by 2%/2% to factor in better-** than-expected outlook for the auto business. Crystal is currently trading at 33x/24x 2025E/26E P/E, which is not cheap but justifiable considering its strong supply chain position and active mindset to lead optical innovation with customers, potentially creating more upside surprises.WeQeiterate BUY and our DCF-based PT at Rmb32.00 (10.3% WACC, 6.0% terminal growth rate) implies 39x 2025E P/E and 1.5x PEG or 28x 2025E P/E and 1.4x PEG, and suggests 15% potential upside.

**Annie Ping, CFA, FRM*|Equity Associate**

A leading optical component vendor with a LT partnership with Apple and covering multiple verticals including smartphone, AR, and automotive. Ongoing innovation in optics and new design wins for optical products in the Apple supply chain. Continued penetration of high- end optical solutions in the Android camp. Increasing adoption rates of auto HUD and LiDAR. Proliferation of AR devices with more mature products introduced in the coming years; Crystal remains a key optical solution provider.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

iPhone hybrid IRCF shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(343m / 570m\) in 2027E/2030E. iPhone micro prism shipment volume rises from 68m in 2024 to \(82m / 90m\) in 2027E/2030E. Variable aperture shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(108m / 105m\) in 2027E/2030E. Camera cover shipment volume rises from 204m in 2024 to \(248m / 276m\) in 2027E/2030E. AR geometric waveguide shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(0.04m / 4.53m\) in 2027E/2030E. PT of Rmb32.00 based on end- 2025E DCF with \(10.3\%\) WACC and \(6.0\%\) terminal growth rate (2030E).

iPhone hybrid IRCF shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(514m / 760m\) in 2027E/2030E. iPhone micro prism shipment volume rises from 68m in 2024 to \(109m / 120m\) in 2027E/2030E. Variable aperture shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(130m / 128m\) in 2027E/2030E. Camera cover shipment volume rises from 204m in 2024 to \(279m / 311m\) in 2027E/2030E. AR geometric waveguide shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(0.13m / 6.03m\) in 2027E/2030E. PT of Rmb39.03 based on end- 2025E DCF with \(10.3\%\) WACC and \(6.5\%\) terminal growth rate (2030E).

iPhone hybrid IRCF shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(171m / 380m\) in 2027E/2030E. iPhone micro prism shipment volume falls from 68m in 2024 to \(54m / 60m\) in 2027E/2030E. Variable aperture shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(65m / 60m\) in 2027E/2030E. Camera cover shipment volume falls from 204m in 2024 to \(186m / 207m\) in 2027E/2030E. AR geometric waveguide shipment volume rises from 0m in 2024 to \(0.02m / 4.08m\) in 2027E/2030E. PT of Rmb21.18 based on end- 2025E DCF with \(10.3\%\) WACC and \(4.0\%\) terminal growth rate (2030E).

1) Product & service quality: Strictly implements quality control standards in incoming material inspection. 2) Exploration & accessibility of technology: Formulated IPD Management Measures to ensure market demand is the driving force for product development. 3) Sustainable supply chain: Multi-dimensional supplier evaluation system & promotes sustainable development of supply chain.

1) Developed high-temperature emergency plans and monitors temperature and humidity in real time. 
2) Established and improves emergency management mechanisms and develops contingency plans. 
3) Implements water-saving measures to reduce water consumption.

1) Any quantifiable ESG goals? 
2) Any plans to cooperate with automakers on low-carbon solutions? ESG Report: https://static.cninfo.com.cn/finalpage/2025-04-10/1223043463.PDF

- Accelerated upgrades on iPhone camera keep raising optics content value. 
- Further market share gain on existing products in Apple. 
- Faster-than-expected penetration of high-end optical solutions in the Android camp. 
- Rapid proliferation of AR-HUD and LiDAR. 
- AR device shipment volume sees significant growth; Crystal remains a key optical solution provider.

Zhejiang Crystal- Optech Co., Ltd. engages in the research, development, manufacture and sale of optical thin film, light- emitting diode sapphire substrate, reflective materials, automation, and equipment. Its products include optical low pass filters and infrared cut- off filters which are applied in digital cameras, mobile phone cameras, light- emitting diodes and computer cameras. The company was founded on August 2, 2002 and is headquartered in Taizhou, China.

Our price target of Rmb32.00 is based on end- 2025E DCF, with a WACC of \(10.3\%\) and a terminal growth rate of \(6.0\%\) (2030E). Key risks include: 1) Apple stops or decelerates iPhone upgrades on optics; 2) Market share loss or fierce competition in the Apple supply chain; 3) ASP/GM pressure on Android and automotive products due to pricing competition; 4) AR devices fail to become mainstream consumer electronic products; and 5) Escalating geopolitical risks bring about supply chain uncertainties and additional costs.

Chongqing Changan Automobile- A Valuation based on 2.4x 24E PB. Key downside risks include 1) slower- than- expected recovery of Ford JV; 2) lower- than- expected sales of newly launched Lincoln cars; and 3) lower- than- expected earnings contribution from ChangAn's own brand.

Goertek Inc. Our price target of Rmb28.00 is based on end- 2025E DCF, with a WACC of \(10.3\%\) and \(5.0\%\) terminal growth (2030E). Key upside/downside risks include: 1) Better/worst- than- expected end- demand (MR, wearable, gaming console, smartphone, etc.); 2) Market share gain/loss in Apple supply chain (acoustics, MEMS, AirPods assembly, etc.); 3) Consumer electronics inventory improves/deteriorates; 4) ASP/GM rise/drop due to strong/weak demand or alleviating/intensifying competition; and 5) Faster/slower- than- expected vertical integration in FATP, leading to stronger/weaker profitability.

Sunny Optical Technology (Group) Co., Ltd. Our price target of HK\$94.00 is based on end- 2025E DCF, with a WACC of \(11.3\%\) and \(6.0\%\) terminal growth (2030E). Key risks include: 1) Slower- than- expected smartphone demand recovery; 2) ASP/GM deterioration on smartphone camera lens/module; 3) Slower- than- expected EV or ADAS penetration; and 4) Slower- than- expected XR demand growth.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a \(15\%\) stop loss, and the remainder will have a \(20\%\) stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
